docs.snippet: There are few things more discouraging to say of a situation than that it is bound to get worse before it gets better--yet that is the case with Uruguay, an attractive, plucky, fiercely democratic little country sinking deeper into a political and...
docs.lead_paragraph: There are few things more discouraging to say of a situation than that it is bound to get worse before it gets better--yet that is the case with Uruguay, an attractive, plucky, fiercely democratic little country sinking deeper into a political and economic mess.

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 28 (UPI)--The 11-nation LatinAmerican Free Trade Association met today to take the first steps toward a common market stretching from the Rio Grande to Cape Horn.

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 30 (UPI)--Foreign Ministers of the Latin American Free Trade Association agreed today to equalize their import duties on products from outside their trading bloc through gradual adjustments over a 15-year period, 1970-1985.

docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 31 A bitter clash pitting Paraguay, Ecuador and Bolivia against the rest of the nations of the Latin American Free Trade Association threatened tonight to block further progress toward the establishment of a Latin American common market.

headline.main: Latins Split on Tariff Policy Deadlocks Parley

byline.original: By BARNARD L. COLLIER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Sept. 1 The Foreign Ministers of 11 member nations of the Latin American Free Trade Association appeared today to have solved one of their most difficult problems how to deal fairly with the group's underdeveloped countries.

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Sept. 2 (AP)--The 11 foreign ministers of the Latin-American Free Trade Association today wearily postponed efforts to form a common market.
